name: QuickHooks PEP 723 Integration
description: Self-contained Claude Code hooks using PEP 723 inline dependencies and UV

example-hook.description: Example hook demonstrating PEP 723 inline dependencies with QuickHooks

agent-analysis-hook.description: Analyzes user prompts and discovers relevant agents automatically using QuickHooks AI analysis

context-portal-hook.description: Provides persistent memory and context management across sessions using QuickHooks

instructions: 2. Set your Groq API key (for agent analysis):
3. Enable hooks by setting 'enabled: true' in the hooks section
4. Dependencies are automatically installed from PyPI on first run via PEP 723
5. UV caches dependencies for instant subsequent executions
notes: No manual dependency installation required - PEP 723 handles it automatically
Each hook is self-contained with inline dependencies
Dependencies are installed from PyPI, not from local quickhooks installation

GROQ_API_KEY.description: Groq API key for agent analysis (required only for agent-analysis-hook)

QUICKHOOKS_AGENT_ANALYSIS_ENABLED.description: Enable or disable automatic agent analysis

QUICKHOOKS_AGENT_MODEL.description: Groq model to use for agent analysis

QUICKHOOKS_CONFIDENCE_THRESHOLD.description: Minimum confidence threshold for agent recommendations

QUICKHOOKS_MIN_SIMILARITY.description: Minimum similarity score for discovered agents

QUICKHOOKS_VERBOSE.description: Enable verbose logging of hook execution

QUICKHOOKS_CONTEXT_PORTAL_ENABLED.description: Enable or disable context portal memory system

pep723_info.description: Inline script metadata for self-contained Python scripts
benefits: Self-contained: Each hook declares its own dependencies
No installation required: Dependencies installed automatically from PyPI
Fast execution: UV caches dependencies for instant runs
Portable: Scripts work anywhere UV is installed
Version controlled: Dependencies versioned within the script
